Value.label: Time Correction by Controller
Value.Help: If this Parameter value = 1 and the HE-TPS05 is connected to a Z-Wave gateway, the HE-TPS05 time and day will be periodically polled and corrected from the gateway. To switch off auto-correction set the Parameter value to 0. The factory default value is 1.

Item.label: Time auto-correction disabled
Time auto-correction enabled

Value.label: Week Day
Value.Help: This parameter allows manual adjustment of the day of the week in case the HE-TPS05 is not connected to any Z- Wave gateway, or Parameter 01 (auto-correction) is selected as 0. The factory default value is 1.

Item.label: Monday
Tuesday
Wednesday
Thursday
Friday
Saturday
Sunday

Value.label: Hour
Value.Help: This Parameter allows manual adjustment of Time: Hours in case the HE-TPS05 is not connected to any Z-Wave gateway, or Parameter 01 (auto-correction) is selected as 0. The factory-default value is 00.

Value.label: Minute
Value.Help: This Parameter allows manual adjustment of Time: Minutes in case the HE-TPS05 is not connected to any Z-Wave gateway, or Parameter 01 (auto-correction) is selected as 0. The factory-default value is 00.

Value.label: Energy Consumption Meter Consecutive Report Interval
Value.Help: This Parameter defines the interval between consecutive reports of real time and cumulative energy consumption data to the gateway. The value can be adjusted from 1 min. to 120 mins. The factory default value is 10 minutes.

Value.label: Sensors Consecutive Report Interval
Value.Help: This Parameter defines the interval between consecutive reports. The value can be adjusted from 1 min to 120 min. The factory default value is 10 min.

Value.label: Air Temperature Sensors Report Threshold
Value.Help: This Parameter determines the change in temperature level (in °C) resulting in temperature sensor report being sent to the gateway. The value of this Parameter should be x10, e.g. for 0.4°C use value 4. From 0.1°C (value 1) to 10°C (value 100) can be selected. Use the value 0 if there is a need to stop sending the reports. The factory default value is 2 (0.2°C).

Value.label: Humidity Sensor Report Threshold
Value.Help: This Parameter determines the change in humidity level in % resulting in humidity sensors report being sent to the gateway. From 1% to 25% can be selected. Use the value 0 if there is a need to stop sending the reports. The factory default value is 2.

Value.label: Light Sensor Report Threshold
Value.Help: This Parameter determines the change in the ambient environment illuminance level resulting in a light sensors report being sent to the gateway. From 10% to 99% can be selected. Use the value 0 if there is a need to stop sending the reports. The factory default value is 50.

Value.label: Touch Buttons Sensitivity Threshold
Value.Help: This Parameter allows the device Touch Button Sensitivity Threshold to be adjusted from level 1 (low sensitivity) to 10 (high sensitivity). The factory default value is 6. Note: Setting the sensitivity too high can lead to false touch detection. We recommend not changing this Parameter unless there is a special need to do so.

Value.label: Temperature Sensor Calibration
Value.Help: This parameter defines the offset value for room air temperature. If the internal air temperature sensor is not correctly calibrated, then manual calibration can be made by adjusting the values up to ±10°C. This value will be added or subtracted from the internal air temperature sensor reading. Through the Z-Wave network the value of this Parameter should be x10, e.g. for 1.5°C set the value 15. The factory default value is 0.

Value.label: Active State Backlight Color
Value.Help: Choose the value “1” if you wish the backlight active state to be blue, and the inactive state to be red (default). Choose the value “0” if you wish the backlight active state to be red, and the inactive state to be blue. The factory default value is 1.

Item.label: Active state is red, inactive state is blue
Active state is blue, inactive state is red

Value.label: Backlight Auto-Brightness Control
Value.Help: The HE-TPS05 can adjust its backlight level automatically depending on the ambient room brightness. If the Parameter value = “0” Inactive Level brightness will be controlled manually and set to the level defined by Parameter 14. If the Parameter value = “1” Inactive Level brightness will be controlled automatically depending on the room illumination. The factory-default value is 1.

Value.label: Backlight Brightness (Manual Mode)
Value.Help: The Backlight Brightness Level Parameter will take effect when Parameter 13 is set to Manual Control (value = 0). The brightness may then be manually adjusted in Parameter 14 from 1 (lowest) to 10 (brightest). The factory-default value is 8.

Value.label: Button 1 Backlight Control Source
Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: If the backlight is disabled (the Parameter value is set to “0”), it is also impossible to control it from the gateway.

Item.label: Backlight is disabled (both color LEDs are turned off)
Backlight is controlled by touch button (reflects the button state)
Backlight is controlled by gateway or associated device (the button state is ignored)

Value.label: Button 2 Backlight Control Source
Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: If the backlight is disabled (the Parameter value is set to “0”), it is also impossible to control it from the gateway.

Item.label: Backlight is disabled (both color LEDs are turned off)
Backlight is controlled by touch button (reflects the button state)
Backlight is controlled by gateway or associated device (the button state is ignored)

Backlight is controlled by touch button (reflects the button state)

Value.Help: The factory default value is 1.

Controlled by touch button N1 (Top Left)
Controlled by touch button N2 (Top Right)
Controlled by touch button N3 (Bottom Left)

Value.Help: The factory default value is 2.

Value.label: Button 1 Hold (Long Press) Control Mode
Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: Regardless of this Parameter, the device will send scene notifications about the touch state (pressed, held, released) to the gateway.

Item.label: Hold function is disabled
Operate like click
When the button is held the relay output state is ON, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to OFF (momentary switch)
When the button is held the relay output state is OFF, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to ON (momentary switch)

Value.label: Button 2 Hold (Long Press) Control Mode
Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: Regardless of this Parameter, the device will send scene notifications about the touch state (pressed, held, released) to the gateway.

Item.label: Hold function is disabled
Operate like click
When the button is held the relay output state is ON, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to OFF (momentary switch)

Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: Regardless of this Parameter, the device will send scene notifications about the touch state (pressed, held, released) to the gateway.

Operate like click
When the button is held the relay output state is ON, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to OFF (momentary switch)
When the button is held the relay output state is OFF, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to ON (momentary switch)

Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: Regardless of this Parameter, the device will send scene notifications about the touch state (pressed, held, released) to the gateway.

Item.label: Hold function is disabled
Operate like click
When the button is held the relay output state is ON, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to OFF (momentary switch)
When the button is held the relay output state is OFF, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to ON (momentary switch)
When the button is held or released the relay output state will toggle its state (ON to OFF or OFF to ON)

Value.label: Button 5 Hold (Long Press) Control Mode
Value.Help: The factory default value is 1. Note: Regardless of this Parameter, the device will send scene notifications about the touch state (pressed, held, released) to the gateway.

Operate like click
When the button is held the relay output state is ON, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to OFF (momentary switch)
When the button is held the relay output state is OFF, as soon as the button is released the relay output state changes to ON (momentary switch)
When the button is held or released the relay output state will toggle its state (ON to OFF or OFF to ON)

Value.label: Button 1 Click (Short Press) Control Mode
Value.Help: The factory default value is 1.

Item.label: Press function disabled
Relay inverts state (toggles ON to OFF, OFF to ON) according to the relay state
Relay inverts state (toggles ON to OFF, OFF to ON) according to the button backlight state

Relay switches to OFF state only

Value.label: Relay 1 Timer mode duration
Value.Help: This Parameter specifies the duration in seconds for the Timer mode (values 5 or 6 in Parameter 30 respectively). Press the button and the relay output goes to ON/OFF for the specified time then changes back to OFF/ON. This function can be used to turn attached devices like door lock or security OFF for a short time. The time values can be configured from 0 sec to 43200 sec (12 hours). The factory default value is 0.

Value.label: Relay 2 Timer mode duration
Value.Help: This Parameter specifies the duration in seconds for the Timer mode (values 5 or 6 in Parameter 31 respectively). Press the button and the relay output goes to ON/OFF for the specified time then changes back to OFF/ON. This function can be used to turn attached devices like door lock or security OFF for a short time. The time values can be configured from 0 sec to 43200 sec (12 hours). The factory default value is 0.

Value.label: Relay 3 Timer mode duration
Value.Help: This Parameter specifies the duration in seconds for the Timer mode (values 5 or 6 in Parameter 32 respectively). Press the button and the relay output goes to ON/OFF for the specified time then changes back to OFF/ON. This function can be used to turn attached devices like door lock or security OFF for a short time. The time values can be configured from 0 sec to 43200 sec (12 hours). The factory default value is 0.

Value.label: Relay 4 Timer mode duration
Value.Help: This Parameter specifies the duration in seconds for the Timer mode (values 5 or 6 in Parameter 33 respectively). Press the button and the relay output goes to ON/OFF for the specified time then changes back to OFF/ON. This function can be used to turn attached devices like door lock or security OFF for a short time. The time values can be configured from 0 sec to 43200 sec (12 hours). The factory default value is 0.

Value.label: Relay 4 Timer mode duration
Value.Help: This Parameter specifies the duration in seconds for the Timer mode (values 5 or 6 in Parameter 34 respectively). Press the button and the relay output goes to ON/OFF for the specified time then changes back to OFF/ON. This function can be used to turn attached devices like door lock or security OFF for a short time. The time values can be configured from 0 sec to 43200 sec (12 hours). The factory default value is 0.

Value.label: Relay Inverse Mode Group 1
Value.Help: The values in this Parameter will specify the relay numbers that will operate in inverse mode. For this purpose, the value will be encoded as a 2-digit number “AB” where “A” is the number of the first relay, and “B” is number of the second relay. For example, if the parameter value is “35” or “53” it means the relays N3 and N5 will operate in inverse mode.

Value.label: Relay Inverse Mode Group 2
Value.Help: The values in this Parameter will specify the relay numbers that will operate in inverse mode. For this purpose, the value will be encoded as a 2-digit number “AB” where “A” is the number of the first relay, and “B” is number of the second relay. For example, if the parameter value is “35” or “53” it means the relays N3 and N5 will operate in inverse mode.

Value.label: Relay Control by Sensors 1
Value.Help: In these Parameters, the relay state changes depending on sensor threshold value. For these configurations, Parameter values are encoded as 8-digit numbers (ABCDEFGH): A: Relay number (1 through 5) B: Control Mode 0-Temperature Sensor, 1-Humidity Sensor, 2-Light Sensor, 3-Time control C: State change relative to value in EFGH Condition Value fields (see below) 0-Equal or lower than 1-Equal or higher than D: State Change 0-Switch OFF 1-Switch ON EFGH: Condition Value “Sensor Value” for Control modes 0, 1, and 2, or “Time” for Control mode 3. If Temperature sensor has been chosen as a source in the control mode, the value should be x10, e.g. for 24.5°C use the value 0245. If Time control has been chosen as a source in the control mode, the device logic will process values EFGH from 0 to 23:59 (in time measure), all other values will be ignored. EF represents Hour (0 through 23), GH represents Minutes (0 through 59).

Value.label: Relay Control by Sensors 2
Value.Help: In these Parameters, the relay state changes depending on sensor threshold value. For these configurations, Parameter values are encoded as 8-digit numbers (ABCDEFGH): A: Relay number (1 through 5) B: Control Mode 0-Temperature Sensor, 1-Humidity Sensor, 2-Light Sensor, 3-Time control C: State change relative to value in EFGH Condition Value fields (see below) 0-Equal or lower than 1-Equal or higher than D: State Change 0-Switch OFF 1-Switch ON EFGH: Condition Value “Sensor Value” for Control modes 0, 1, and 2, or “Time” for Control mode 3. If Temperature sensor has been chosen as a source in the control mode, the value should be x10, e.g. for 24.5°C use the value 0245. If Time control has been chosen as a source in the control mode, the device logic will process values EFGH from 0 to 23:59 (in time measure), all other values will be ignored. EF represents Hour (0 through 23), GH represents Minutes (0 through 59).

For these configurations, Parameter values are encoded as 8-digit numbers (ABCDEFGH): A: Relay number (1 through 5) B: Control Mode 0-Temperature Sensor, 1-Humidity Sensor, 2-Light Sensor, 3-Time control C: State change relative to value in EFGH Condition Value fields (see below) 0-Equal or lower than 1-Equal or higher than D: State Change 0-Switch OFF 1-Switch ON EFGH: Condition Value “Sensor Value” for Control modes 0, 1, and 2, or “Time” for Control mode 3. If Temperature sensor has been chosen as a source in the control mode, the value should be x10, e.g. for 24.5°C use the value 0245. EF represents Hour (0 through 23), GH represents Minutes (0 through 59).

Value.label: Relay 1 Load Power in watt
Value.Help: This Parameter is used to specify the load power that are connected to the device output. Using your connected device’s power consumption specification (see associated owner’s manual), set the load in Watts. The factory default value is 0. Note: The range from 0 to 1100 watt can be selected.

Value.label: Relay 2 Load Power in watt
Value.Help: This Parameter is used to specify the load power that are connected to the device output. Using your connected device’s power consumption specification (see associated owner’s manual), set the load in Watts. The factory default value is 0. Note: The range from 0 to 1100 watt can be selected.

Value.Help: This Parameter is used to specify the load power that are connected to the device output. Using your connected device’s power consumption specification (see associated owner’s manual), set the load in Watts. The factory default value is 0. Note: The range from 0 to 1100 watt can be selected.

Value.Help: This Parameter is used to specify the load power that are connected to the device output. Note: The range from 0 to 1100 watt can be selected.

Value.label: Association Mode for Touch Button 1
Value.Help: This Parameter is intended for use when Multilevel Switch Group Association (Groups 3) have been activated. It defines the logic of values changing if the touch button has been held for more than one second. This is useful option for controlling dimmers or roller shutter devices The factory-default value is 0.

Item.label: On each hold event, “UP (brighten)” and “DOWN (dim)” command will be alternately sent to associated devices
On each hold event, the “UP (brighten)” command will be sent to associated devices
On each hold event, the “DOWN (dim)” command will be sent to associated devices

Value.label: Association Mode for Touch Button 2
Value.Help: This Parameter is intended for use when Multilevel Switch Group Association (Groups 5) have been activated. On each hold event, the “DOWN (dim)” command will be sent to associated devices

Value.label: Frequency Region
Value.Help: The TPS04 has Z-Wave 700 platform chip inside which allows to use the device in different Z-Wave frequencies. If there is a need to use the device in the frequency different from the factory default change the value of this parameter according to the frequency list.

Item.label: ANZ (919.8 MHz, 921.4 MHz)
HK (919.8 MHz)
IN (865.2 MHz)
IL (916.0 MHz)
RU (869.0 MHz)
CH (868.4 MHz)

Value.label: Relay 1 Output NO/NC Mode
Value.Help: This Parameter determines the type of load connected to the device relay output. The output type can be NO – normal open (no contact/voltage to switch the load OFF) or NC - normal close (output is contacted / there is a voltage to switch the load OFF). The factory default value is 0 (NO mode).

Item.label: NO – normal open mode
NC - normal close mode

Value.label: Relay 2 Output NO/NC Mode

The output type can be NO – normal open (no contact/voltage to switch the load OFF) or NC - normal close (output is contacted / there is a voltage to switch the load OFF). The factory default value is 0 (NO mode).

Item.label: NO – normal open mode
NC - normal close mode
